tika-s0401t5:10_0: ‘This mendicant is committed to the higher mind should focus on three foundations from time to time on the foundation of immersion; the foundation of exertion and the foundation of equanimity.
tika-s0401t5:10_1: If a mendicant dedicated to the higher mind focuses solely on the foundation of immersion, it’s likely their mind will incline to laziness.
tika-s0401t5:10_2: If they focus solely on the foundation of exertion, it’s likely their mind will incline to restlessness.
tika-s0401t5:10_3: If they focus solely on the foundation of equanimity, it’s likely their mind won’t properly become immersed in samādhi for the ending of defilements.

tika-s0401t5:11_0: Or a goldsmith or their apprentice prepares a forge, fires the crucible, picks up some gold with tongs and puts it in the crucible. From time to time they fan it, from time to time they sprinkle water on it, and from time to time they just watch over it.
tika-s0401t5:11_1: If they solely fanned it, the gold would likely be scorched.
tika-s0401t5:11_2: If they solely watched over it, the gold would likely be extinguished.
tika-s0401t5:11_3: If they solely watched over it, the gold would likely not be properly processed.
